intro: Hyptis nitidula, commonly known as white hyptis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils under full sun to partial shade. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
